original: @27b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @27b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: s'i ta t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
analyzed: s'i ta t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
translated: Sitātapatrāsadhana

original: bod skad du /🔽sgrol ma dkar mo sgrub pa'i thabs /
analyzed: bod skad du / sgrol ma dkar mo sgrub pa'i thabs /
translated: In Tibetan:🔽Dkar mo sgrol ma’i sgrub thabs

original: bcom ldan 'das sgrol ma dkar mo la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sgrol ma dkar mo la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed White Tārā.

original: sngon bzhin du sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas nas /🔽aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: sngon bzhin du sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas nas / aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: As before, having done the confession of sins and so forth,🔽one should recite the mantra: “Oṃ śūnyatājñānavajrasvabhāvātmako ’haṃ.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this mantra.🔽🔽

original: de nas sum yongs su gyur pa las rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin ri rab bo //
analyzed: de nas sum yongs su gyur pa las rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin ri rab bo //
translated: Then, from the transformation of the syllable suṃ, there is Mount Meru, which is the nature of various jewels.

original: de'i steng du pam las padma dkar po //
analyzed: de'i steng du pam las padma dkar po //
translated: Upon that, from paṃ, there is a white lotus.

original: de'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Upon that, from aḥ, there is a moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i dbus su h'um dkar po las yongs su rdzogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma mdog dkar ba spyan gsum ma /
analyzed: de'i dbus su h'um dkar po las yongs su rdzogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma mdog dkar ba spyan gsum ma /
translated: In the center of that, from a white hūṃ, is the completely perfect Blessed One, Tārā, who is white, has three eyes,

original: phyag bzhi pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa lnga'i dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa lnga'i dbu rgyan can /
translated: and has four arms. She has the crown ornament of the five tathāgatas.

original: rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa ;
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa ;
translated: She is adorned with various ornaments.

original: phyag dang po gnyis kyis autpa la'i phyag rgya 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag dang po gnyis kyis autpa la'i phyag rgya 'dzin pa /
translated: The first two hands hold a lotus mudra.

original: g-yas kyi phyag na yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang ldan pa'i mchog sbyin pas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: g-yas kyi phyag na yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang ldan pa'i mchog sbyin pas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: The right hand holds a wish-fulfilling jewel and makes the boon-granting gesture, fulfilling the wishes of sentient beings.

original: g-yon pa na autpa la'i snye ma bsnams pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa na autpa la'i snye ma bsnams pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: The left hand holds a cluster of utpala flowers.

original: de'i g-yas phyogs kyi logs su lha mo 'od zer can mdog ser ba zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa gos sngon po phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: de'i g-yas phyogs kyi logs su lha mo 'od zer can mdog ser ba zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa gos sngon po phyag gnyis pa /
translated: To the right of that, imagine yellow goddess Marici standing on a moon disc, wearing blue garments, with two hands.

original: g-yon pa na mya ngan med dmar po'i yal ga bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa na mya ngan med dmar po'i yal ga bsnams pa /
translated: The left hand holds a branch of red aśoka.

original: g-yas pa rna rnga yab dkar po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: g-yas pa rna rnga yab dkar po dang ldan pa /
translated: The right hand holds a white yak-tail whisk.

original: sha 'gag dmar pos brgyan pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sha 'gag dmar pos brgyan pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: She is adorned with a red sash.

original: g-yon pa'i logs @28a * //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i logs @28a * //
translated: To the left,

original: su rma bya chen mo mdog ljang ser phyag gnyis pa g-yon pa na rma bya'i gzhug sgro bsnams pa /
analyzed: su rma bya chen mo mdog ljang ser phyag gnyis pa g-yon pa na rma bya'i gzhug sgro bsnams pa /
translated: imagine Mahāmāyūrī, green in color, with two hands. The left hand holds a peacock feather.

original: g-yas pa na rnga yab bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yas pa na rnga yab bsnams pa /
translated: The right hand holds a yak-tail whisk.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par bsams la /
translated: Imagine her in that form.

original: aom bha ga ba t'i t'a re ma ma hri da yam pra bi sha sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom bha ga ba t'i t'a re ma ma hri da yam pra bi sha sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ bhagavatī tāre mam hṛdayaṃ praviśa svāhā.

original: zhes bya bas bdag nyid byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas bdag nyid byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Recite this mantra for the consecration of oneself.

original: de nas aom na ma t'a re ma no ha re h'um ha ra sv'ah'a /
analyzed: de nas aom na ma t'a re ma no ha re h'um ha ra sv'ah'a /
translated: Then, Oṃ namastārā manonahari hūṃ hara svāhā.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Recite this mantra.

original: sgrol ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs slob dpon yid bzhin nor bu rgyal pos mdzad pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: sgrol ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs slob dpon yid bzhin nor bu rgyal pos mdzad pa rdzogs so //
translated: The sādhana of White Tārā composed by the master Cintamani Rāja is complete.

original: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur cing zhus pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur cing zhus pa'o /
translated: Translated, revised, and finalized by the paṇḍita Amoghavajra and the Khampa translator-monk Bari.
